org.csstudio.platform.logging
Class CentralLogger

java.lang.Object
  org.csstudio.platform.logging.CentralLogger

public final class CentralLogger
extends java.lang.Object

The central logging service of the CSS platform. The service is implemented as singleton. A reference can be obtained by

CentralLogger.getInstance()

Logging is straight forward. For example, you can use the Logger this way:

CentralLogger.getInstance().debug(this, "test log message");
CentralLogger.getInstance().info(this, "test log message");

Author:
Alexander Will, Sven Wende

info

public void info(java.lang.Object caller,
                 java.lang.String message)
Log a message with log level info. The reference to the calling object is used to automatically generate more detailled log4j messages.

Parameters:
caller - The calling object.
message - The log message.

private void fillFromStore(java.util.Properties p,
                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.Preferences prefs,
                           java.lang.String propertyID)

Parameters:
p - Properties object to fill.
prefs - Plugin preference store.
propertyID - The ID of the certain property.

checkJmsSettings

private boolean checkJmsSettings(java.util.Properties p)
Check if the given JMS settings are valid.

Parameters:
p - System properties.
Returns:
